title: Arthurian Caerleon in Literature and Legend
description: For centuries visitors have come to Caerleon-upon-Usk in search of an Arthurian atmosphere, but in recent years so mush emphasis has been given to the Roman remains that the legendary and literary associations of the famous Dark Age king have been largely ignored.This little book has been written and designed by the well known author Chris Barber to provide background to Caerleon's Athurian associations. These were established in the 12th century by Geoffrey of Monmouth and continued by other writers through the ages such as Gerald of Wales, Sir Thomas Malory and the Victorian Poet Laureate, Alfred Lord Tennyson.King Arthur us one of the most popular literary subjects in the world and his life and deeds have been romantically portrayed through a fascinating assortment of novels, poems, works of historical detection, operas, films and paintings. It can be safely said that his story in all its forms will continue to captivate a wide audience and those who come to Caerleon-upon-Usk are in truth visiting the ancient land of King Arthur.
author: Chris Barber
